trans-unit.source: Represents a collection of <xref href="System.Web.Configuration.UrlMapping"></xref> objects.
This class cannot be inherited.

The UrlMappingCollection type allows access to the <xref:System.Web.Configuration.UrlMappingsSection.UrlMappings%2A> elements of the <xref:System.Web.Configuration.UrlMappingsSection> section element collection.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Web.Configuration.UrlMappingCollection"></xref> class.
The UrlMappingCollection constructor is not intended to be used directly from your code.
It is called by the ASP.NET configuration system.
You obtain an instance of the <xref:System.Web.Configuration.UrlMappingCollection> class by using <xref:System.Web.Configuration.UrlMappingsSection.UrlMappings%2A> property.
Adds the specified <xref href="System.Web.Configuration.UrlMapping"></xref> to the collection.
The <xref href="System.Web.Configuration.UrlMapping"></xref> object to add to the collection.
Gets an array of the keys for all of the configuration elements contained in the <xref href="System.Web.Configuration.UrlMappingCollection"></xref>.
An array of the keys for all of the <xref href="System.Web.Configuration.UrlMapping"></xref> objects contained in the <xref href="System.Web.Configuration.UrlMappingCollection"></xref>.
Removes all the <xref href="System.Web.Configuration.UrlMapping"></xref> objects from the collection.
If you save the configuration file after calling the Clear method, the result will be dependent upon the chosen <xref:System.Configuration.ConfigurationSaveMode>.

The following list describes the conditions that apply if you use the <xref:System.Configuration.Configuration.Save%2A> method to save the file: - If you pass <xref:System.Configuration.ConfigurationSaveMode> or <xref:System.Configuration.ConfigurationSaveMode?displayProperty=fullName> as the parameter value, a `clear` element is inserted into the `urlMappings` section of the configuration file at the current hierarchy level.

- If you pass <xref:System.Configuration.ConfigurationSaveMode> as the parameter value, a series of `remove` elements are added to the `urlMappings` of the configuration file at the current hierarchy level.
These `remove` elements remove all references to the `add` elements defined in the parent configuration files at higher levels in the hierarchy.
With the <xref:System.Configuration.ConfigurationSaveMode> enumeration value, there is one additional property on the collection that affects what gets serialized to the configuration file.
The property is <xref:System.Configuration.ConfigurationElementCollection.EmitClear%2A> and is `false` by default.
One of the following conditions applies: - <xref:System.Configuration.ConfigurationElementCollection.EmitClear%2A> set to `true`.
A `clear` element is inserted into the `urlMappings` section of the configuration file at the current hierarchy level.
This removes all references to the `add` elements defined in the parent configuration files at higher levels in the hierarchy.
- <xref:System.Configuration.ConfigurationElementCollection.EmitClear%2A> flag is set to `false`.
This has the effect of removing the `clear` element from the `urlMappings` section of the configuration file at the current hierarchy level, if it exists.
The Clear method actually deletes the `add` elements defined in the `urlMappings` section of the configuration file at the current hierarchy level.
It also removes all references to the `add` elements defined in the parent configuration files at higher levels in the hierarchy but does not delete them.
To be added.
To be added.
To be added.
Gets the collection key of the specified element.
The collection index of the element to get.
A string representing the value of the key.
Gets or sets the <xref href="System.Web.Configuration.UrlMapping"></xref> object at the specified index.
The index of the object to get.
The object at the specified index.
Gets the <xref href="System.Web.Configuration.UrlMapping"></xref> object with the specified name.
The name of the collection object.
The collection object that has the specified name.
To be added.
Removes the <xref href="System.Web.Configuration.UrlMapping"></xref> object with the specified name from the collection.
The Remove method deletes the `add` element in the `urlMappings` section at the current hierarchy level and inserts a `remove` element.
The remove element effectively removes the reference to the `add` element defined in the parent configuration files at higher levels in the hierarchy but does not delete it.
The name of the <xref href="System.Web.Configuration.UrlMapping"></xref> object to remove from the collection.
Removes the specified <xref href="System.Web.Configuration.UrlMapping"></xref> object from the collection.
The Remove method deletes the `add` element in the `urlMappings` section at the current hierarchy level and inserts a `remove` element.
The remove element effectively removes the reference to the `add` element defined in the parent configuration files at higher levels in the hierarchy but does not delete it.
The <xref href="System.Web.Configuration.UrlMapping"></xref> object to remove from the collection.
Removes the <xref href="System.Web.Configuration.UrlMapping"></xref> object with the specified index from the collection.
The RemoveAt method deletes the `add` element in the `urlMappings` section at the current hierarchy level and inserts a `remove` element.
The remove element effectively removes the reference to the `add` element defined in the parent configuration files at higher levels in the hierarchy but does not delete it.
The collection index of the <xref href="System.Web.Configuration.UrlMapping"></xref> object to remove.
